text: How big is the registry download? While I’m very excited for the recent debugging developments in <https://github.com/JuliaLang/Downloads.jl/issues/99#issuecomment-785931186>, I’m also a bit puzzled why it’s not possible to download the registry within the time limit.

elements.text: How big is the registry download? While I’m very excited for the recent debugging developments in
, I’m also a bit puzzled why it’s not possible to download the registry within the time limit.
$ curl -sLI

| rg Content-Length
Content-Length: 2793909

text: But there are actually 2 requests so that's probably why, rather than the size.

elements.text: But there are actually 2 requests so that's probably why, rather than the size.

text:
First this:
```$ curl <https://eu-central.pkg.julialang.org/registries>
/registry/23338594-aafe-5451-b93e-139f81909106/18e32853c5db42309e4fcf3f2c7f0f92678fed63```
and after that requesting that resource

text: But still, should it take more than 30 seconds?

elements.text: But still, should it take more than 30 seconds?
did it?

text: It does but I’m using a different package server so maybe it’s specific to that one.

elements.text: It does but I’m using a different package server so maybe it’s specific to that one.

text: I’m testing with the default one now

elements.text: I’m testing with the default one now
It was almost instant.

text: Is there a way for me to make Pkg use the US julialang servers. I’m curious what the effect of the Atlantic Ocean is here

elements.text: Is there a way for me to make Pkg use the US julialang servers. I’m curious what the effect of the Atlantic Ocean is here

text: You can set `JULIA_PKG_SERVER` to `<https://us-west.pkg.julialang.org>` for example

elements.text: You can set
JULIA_PKG_SERVER
to
for example

text: Thanks. It finished in ~1.5 seconds so I think we have an issue with our package server.

elements.text: Thanks. It finished in ~1.5 seconds so I think we have an issue with our package server.

text: I think there was a other, unrelated problem that was fixed by moving to HTTP1

elements.text: I think there was a other, unrelated problem that was fixed by moving to HTTP1

text: Here I did hit the 30 seconds limit though. I tried timing it to be sure. Thankfully, the issue with specific package server has now been identified and fixed
